goals.question: What is the distribution of flight delays?
goals.rationale: This tells us how many flights are delayed and by how much time. It can help us identify patterns and trends in flight delays.

goals.question: What is the average flight time for different airlines?
goals.visualization: Bar chart of airline vs. average flight time
goals.rationale: This can help us compare the performance of different airlines in terms of flight time and identify which airlines are faster or slower.

goals.question: What is the relationship between flight distance and fuel consumption?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of distance vs. fuel_consumed
goals.rationale: This can help us understand how much fuel is consumed for different flight distances and identify any outliers or patterns in the data.

goals.question: What is the distribution of flight cancellations by reason?
goals.rationale: This can help us understand the main reasons for flight cancellations and identify any trends or patterns in the data.

goals.question: What is the busiest time of day for flights?
goals.visualization: Line chart of time vs. number_of_flights
goals.rationale: This can help us identify the peak hours for flights and plan accordingly for scheduling and staffing purposes.

code:
import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['departure_delay'] = pd.to_numeric(data['departure_delay'], errors='coerce')
    sns.histplot(data=data, x='departure_delay', kde=True, color='blue')
    plt.axvline(x=data['departure_delay'].median(), color='red', label=f'Median: {data["departure_delay"].median():.2f}')
    plt.legend()
    plt.title('What is the distribution of flight delays?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['flight_time'] = pd.to_datetime(data['flight_time'], format='%H:%M:%S', errors='coerce')
    data['flight_time'] = data['flight_time'].dt.hour + data['flight_time'].dt.minute/60
    chart = sns.barplot(x='airline', y='flight_time', data=data, ci=None)
    chart.axhline(y=data['flight_time'].mean(), color='r', linestyle='--', label='Mean flight time: {:.2f}'.format(data['flight_time'].mean()))
    chart.set(xlabel='Airline', ylabel='Average Flight Time (hours)')
    chart.legend()
    return chart

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['fuel_consumed'] = data['fuel_total'] / data['passengers']
    chart = sns.scatterplot(x='distance', y='fuel_consumed', data=data)
    plt.title('What is the relationship between flight distance and fuel consumption?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['count'] = 1
    df = data.groupby('cancellation_reason').count().reset_index()
    plt.pie(df['count'], labels=df['cancellation_reason'], autopct='%1.1f%%')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of flight cancellations by reason?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['time'] = pd.to_datetime(data['time'], format='%H:%M:%S', errors='coerce')
    data['hour'] = data['time'].dt.hour
    flights_by_hour = data.groupby('hour').size().reset_index(name='number_of_flights')
    chart = sns.lineplot(x='hour', y='number_of_flights', data=flights_by_hour)
    chart.axvline(x=flights_by_hour['number_of_flights'].idxmax(), color='red', linestyle='--', label='Busiest hour: {:.2f}'.format(flights_by_hour['number_of_flights'].max()))
    chart.legend()
    plt.title('What is the busiest time of day for flights?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
